result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett R. Kewenig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees.**
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
**Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.**
**If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.**
**Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.**
May not have contact with Anthony Armato.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brett R. Kewenig

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

10:25 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brett R. Kewenig in court.  Attorney J. Eric Olson in court for Brett R. Kewenig. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Matter is resolved and agreement is placed on the record. State amends count to Wis. stat. 450.11(7)(h) Possession/Illegally Obtained Prescription and files amended information electronically. Attorney Olson acknowledges and waives reading of the amended information. Defendant entered a plea of guilty to the amended count; found guilty by the court. Sentencing arguments heard. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 1 year w/conditions. No contact with Anthony A.. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. 5 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court costs, Drug surcharge and DNA surcharge ordered.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.

Defendant, Brett R. Kewenig, appeared with Attorney J. Eric Olson.  Attorney Emily K. Gaertner appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:25 AM Defendant, Brett R. Kewenig, appeared.  Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Atty Olson has been appointed but had no notice of hearing today.   DE waives time for preliminary hearing to allow for Attorney to be present for hearing.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Anthony A.  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's A.A. residence and RM 104 within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.    No drug paraphenalia

01:39 PM
  Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michelle Knapp.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 8/18/2 @ 9:00am.  $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).     jk
and witness list filed by the State
